original: 8 Cittayamaka🔽8.1 Uddesa
analyzed: citta yamaka  uddesa
translated: . Enumeration

original: 8.1.1. Suddhacittasāmañña
translated: ... The Similarity of Pure Consciousness

original: 8.1.1.1. Puggalavāra
analyzed: puggala vāra
translated: .... The Section on Persons

original: 8.1.1.1.1. Uppādanirodhakālasambhedavāra
translated: ..... The Section on the Difference in Time of Arising and Ceasing

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati
translated: For one whose consciousness arises and does not cease, will that consciousness cease and not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tassa cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati
translated: Or for one whose consciousness will cease and not arise, will that consciousness arise and not cease?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhissati uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjati nirujjhati tassa cittam na nirujjhissati uppajjissati
translated: For one whose consciousness does not arise and cease, will that consciousness not cease and arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhissati uppajjissati tassa cittam na uppajjati nirujjhati
translated: Or for one whose consciousness will not cease and arise, will that consciousness not arise and cease?

original: 8.1.1.1.2. Uppāduppannavāra
translated: ..... The Section on Arisen and Unarisen

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam uppanna
translated: For one whose consciousness arises, is that consciousness arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppannam tassa cittam uppajjati
translated: Or for one whose consciousness is arisen, does that consciousness arise?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: For one whose consciousness does not arise, is that consciousness not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na uppajjati
translated: Or, if his cognizance has not arisen, has his cognizance arisen?

original: 8.1.1.1.3. Nirodhuppannavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam nirujjhati tassa cittam uppanna
translated: ..... The Section on Cessation and Arising🔽Is there any cognizance that is ceasing, and is there any cognizance that has arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ nirujjhati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppannam tassa cittam nirujjhati  yassa cittam na nirujjhati tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: Or, if there is any cognizance that has arisen, is there any cognizance that is ceasing?🔽Is there any cognizance that is not ceasing, and is there any cognizance that has not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na nirujjhati
translated: Or, if there is any cognizance that has not arisen, is there any cognizance that is not ceasing?

original: 8.1.1.1.4. Uppādavāra
analyzed: uppāda vāra
translated: ..... The Section on Arising

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam uppajjittha
translated: Is there any cognizance that is arising, and is there any cognizance that has arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppajjittha tassa cittam uppajjati
translated: Or, if there is any cognizance that has arisen, is there any cognizance that is arising?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam na uppajjittha
translated: Is there any cognizance that is not arising, and is there any cognizance that has not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjittha tassa cittam na uppajjati  yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam uppajjissati
translated: Or, if there is any cognizance that has not arisen, is there any cognizance that is not arising?🔽Is there any cognizance that is arising, and is there any cognizance that will arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppajjissati tassa cittam uppajjati
translated: Or, if there is any cognizance that will arise, is there any cognizance that is arising?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam na uppajjissati
translated: Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind does not arise did not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjissati tassa cittam na uppajjati  yassa cittam uppajjittha tassa cittam uppajjissati
translated: Or, has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind is not going to arise did not arise?🔽Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind arose arose?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ uppajjittha?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppajjissati tassa cittam uppajjittha  yassa cittam na uppajjittha tassa cittam na uppajjissati
translated: Or, has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind is going to arise is going to arise?🔽Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind did not arise did not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjissati tassa cittam na uppajjittha
translated: Or, has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind is not going to arise is not going to arise?

original: 8.1.1.1.5. Nirodhavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam nirujjhati tassa cittam
translated: ..... The Section on Cessation🔽Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind ceases ceased?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ nirujjhati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhittha tassa cittam nirujjhati  yassa cittam na nirujjhati tassa cittam na
translated: Or, has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind has ceased ceased?🔽Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind does not cease did not cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhittha tassa cittam na nirujjhati
translated: Or, has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind is not going to cease is not going to cease?

original: Yassa cittaṁ nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam nirujjhati tassa cittam nirujjhissati
translated: Has there ever been a time when the mind of one whose mind ceases will cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhissati tassa cittam nirujjhati  yassa cittam na nirujjhati tassa cittam na nirujjhissati
translated: Or, if someone’s mind will cease, does their mind cease?🔽If someone’s mind does not cease, will their mind not cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhissati tassa cittam na nirujjhati
translated: Or, if someone’s mind will not cease, does their mind not cease?

original: Yassa cittaṁ nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam nirujjhittha tassa cittam nirujjhissati
translated: If someone’s mind has ceased, will their mind cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhittha?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhissati tassa cittam  yassa cittam na nirujjhittha tassa cittam na nirujjhissati
translated: Or, if someone’s mind will cease, has their mind ceased?🔽If someone’s mind has not ceased, will their mind not cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhissati tassa cittam na
translated: Or, if someone’s mind will not cease, has their mind not ceased?

original: 8.1.1.1.6. Uppādanirodhavāra
translated: The section on arising and ceasing

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam
translated: If someone’s mind arises, has their mind ceased?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhittha tassa cittam uppajjati  yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam na
translated: Or, if someone’s mind has ceased, does their mind arise?🔽If someone’s mind does not arise, has their mind not ceased?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhittha tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhittha tassa cittam na uppajjati
translated: Or, if someone’s mind has not ceased, does their mind not arise?

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam nirujjhissati
translated: Whose mind arises, will that mind cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhissati tassa cittam uppajjati  yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam na nirujjhissati
translated: Or, whose mind will cease, did that mind arise?🔽Whose mind does not arise, will that mind not cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhissati tassa cittam na uppajjati
translated: Or, whose mind will not cease, does that mind not arise?

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjittha tassa cittam nirujjhissati
translated: Whose mind has arisen, will that mind cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ uppajjittha?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhissati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhissati tassa cittam uppajjittha  yassa cittam na uppajjittha tassa cittam na nirujjhissati
translated: Or, whose mind will cease, has that mind arisen?🔽Whose mind has not arisen, will that mind not cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhissati tassa cittam na uppajjittha
translated: Or, whose mind will not cease, has that mind not arisen?

original: 8.1.1.1.7. Uppajjamānananirodhavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppajjati tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhati?🔽Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjati tassa cittam na nirujjhati  yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhati tassa cittam uppajjati
translated: ... The Section on Arising and Ceasing, in Response🔽Whose mind arises, does that mind not cease?🔽Or, whose mind does not cease, does that mind arise?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjati tassa cittaṁ nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjati tassa cittam nirujjhati
translated: Whose mind does not arise, does that mind cease?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhati tassa cittaṁ na uppajjati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhati tassa cittam na uppajjati
translated: Or, when someone’s mind is ceasing, is his mind arising?

original: 8.1.1.1.8. Uppajjamānuppannavāra
analyzed: uppajjamāna uppanna vāra
translated: ..... The Section on Arising and Having Arisen

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppajjamānaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjamānam tassa cittam uppanna
translated: When someone’s mind is arising, has his mind arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppajjamānaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppannam tassa cittam uppajjamāna
translated: Or, when someone’s mind has arisen, is his mind arising?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjamānaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjamānam tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: When someone’s mind is not arising, has his mind not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppajjamānaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na uppajjamāna
translated: Or, when someone’s mind has not arisen, is his mind not arising?

original: 8.1.1.1.9. Nirujjhamānuppannavāra
translated: ..... The Section on Ceasing and Having Ceased

original: Yassa cittaṁ nirujjhamānaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam nirujjhamānam tassa cittam uppanna
translated: When someone’s mind is ceasing, has his mind arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ nirujjhamānaṁ?🔽Yassa cittaṁ na nirujjhamānaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppannam tassa cittam nirujjhamāna  yassa cittam na nirujjhamānam tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: Or, when someone’s mind has arisen, is his mind ceasing?🔽When someone’s mind is not ceasing, has his mind not arisen?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na nirujjhamānaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na
translated: Or, when someone’s mind has not arisen, is his mind not ceasing?

original: 8.1.1.1.10. Uppannuppādavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppannam tassa cittam uppajjittha
translated: ..... The Section on Arisen and Arising🔽When someone’s mind has arisen, is his mind arising?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam uppajjittha tassa cittam uppanna
translated: Or, when someone’s mind is arising, has his mind arisen?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na uppajjittha
translated: Has there ever been a consciousness that did not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjittha tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjittha tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: Or, has there ever been a consciousness that did not arise, but will arise?

original: Yassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ uppajjissati?🔽Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppannam tassa cittam uppajjissati  yassa vā pana cittam uppajjissati tassa cittam uppanna
translated: Has there ever been a consciousness that arose?🔽Or, will there ever be a consciousness that arises, but has not yet arisen?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ tassa cittaṁ na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppannam tassa cittam na uppajjissati
translated: Has there ever been a consciousness that did not arise, but will not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjissati tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjissati tassa cittam na uppanna
translated: Or, will there ever be a consciousness that did not arise, but will not arise?

original: 8.1.1.1.11. Atītānāgatavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppajjittha no ca tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ, tassa cittaṁ uppajjissati?🔽Yassa vā pana cittaṁ uppajjissati no ca tassa cittaṁ uppannaṁ, tassa cittaṁ uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa cittam uppajjittha no ca tassa cittam uppanna tassa cittam uppajjissati  yassa vā pana cittam uppajjissati no ca tassa cittam uppanna tassa cittam uppajjittha
translated: ..... The past and future section🔽Has there ever been a consciousness that arose, but has not yet arisen?🔽Or, will there ever be a consciousness that arises, but has not yet arisen?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha no ca tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ, tassa cittaṁ na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjittha no ca tassa cittam na uppanna tassa cittam na uppajjissati
translated: Has there ever been a consciousness that did not arise, but will not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na uppajjissati no ca tassa cittaṁ na uppannaṁ, tassa cittaṁ na uppajjittha?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na uppajjissati no ca tassa cittam na uppanna tassa cittam na uppajjittha
translated: Or, if his cognizance does not arise, is his cognizance not arisen?

original: 8.1.1.1.12. Uppannuppajjamānavāra🔽Uppannaṁ uppajjamānaṁ?
analyzed: uppanna uppajjamāna vāra  uppannam uppajjamāna
translated: … The Section on Arisen and Arising🔽Arisen and arising?

original: Uppajjamānaṁ uppannaṁ?🔽Na uppannaṁ na uppajjamānaṁ?
analyzed: uppajjamānam uppanna  na uppannam na uppajjamāna
translated: Arising and arisen?🔽Not arisen and not arising?

original: Na uppajjamānaṁ na uppannaṁ?
analyzed: na uppajjamānam na uppanna
translated: Not arising and not arisen?

original: 8.1.1.1.13. Niruddhanirujjhamānavāra🔽Niruddhaṁ nirujjhamānaṁ?
analyzed: niruddham nirujjhamāna
translated: … The Section on Ceased and Ceasing🔽Ceased and ceasing?

original: Nirujjhamānaṁ niruddhaṁ?🔽Na niruddhaṁ na nirujjhamānaṁ?
analyzed: nirujjhamānam niruddha  na niruddham na nirujjhamāna
translated: Ceasing and ceased?🔽Not ceased and not ceasing?

original: Na nirujjhamānaṁ na niruddhaṁ?
analyzed: na nirujjhamānam na
translated: Not ceasing and not ceased?

original: 8.1.1.1.14. Atikkantakālavāra🔽Yassa cittaṁ uppajjamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ, nirujjhamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ tassa cittaṁ?
analyzed: atikkanta kālavāra  yassa cittam uppajjamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kāla nirujjhamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kālam tassa citta
translated: … The Section on the Time Past🔽Whose cognizance, as it arises, moment after moment goes past the time when it arose, and as it ceases, moment after moment goes past the time when it ceased, is that cognizance his?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ, uppajjamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ tassa cittaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam nirujjhamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kāle uppajjamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kālam tassa citta nirujjhamānam
translated: Or, if his cognizance, as it ceases, moment after moment goes past the time when it ceased, and as it arises, moment after moment goes past the time when it arose, is that cognizance his?

original: Yassa cittaṁ na uppajjamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ, na nirujjhamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ tassa cittaṁ?
analyzed: yassa cittam na uppajjamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kāla na nirujjhamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kālam tassa cittam
translated: Whose consciousness, when it arises, does not pass on, does not go beyond the moment? Whose consciousness, when it ceases, does not pass on, does not go beyond the moment?

original: Yassa vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ, na uppajjamānaṁ khaṇaṁ khaṇaṁ vītikkantaṁ atikkantakālaṁ tassa cittaṁ?
analyzed: yassa vā pana cittam na nirujjhamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kāla na uppajjamānam khaṇam khaṇam vītikkantam atikkanta kālam tassa citta
translated: Whose consciousness, when it ceases, does not pass on, does not go beyond the moment? Whose consciousness, when it arises, does not pass on, does not go beyond the moment?

original: 8.1.1.2. Dhammavāra
analyzed: dhammavāra
translated: .... The section on the True Idea

original: 8.1.1.2.1. Uppādanirodhakālasambhedavāra🔽Yaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati taṁ cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati?🔽Yaṁ vā pana cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati taṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati tam cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati  yam vā pana cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati
translated: .... The section on the analysis of the time of arising and ceasing🔽Is there consciousness that arises and does not cease, and will arise and not cease?🔽Or is there consciousness that will arise and not cease, and does not arise and not cease?

original: Yaṁ cittaṁ na uppajjati nirujjhati taṁ cittaṁ na nirujjhissati uppajjissati?
analyzed: yam cittam na uppajjati nirujjhati tam cittam na nirujjhissati uppajjissati
translated: Is there consciousness that does not arise and ceases, and will not arise and cease?

original: Yaṁ vā pana cittaṁ na nirujjhissati uppajjissati taṁ cittaṁ na uppajjati nirujjhati?
